Method Detail

populateMap

public void populateMap(java.lang.String aPropRoot)
Description copied from class: AeMessageFormatter
Use the plugin.properties property root to cycle through all format definitions for that group and add the formats to the map.

Lists of Message Formatting strings are defined in plugin.properties as:

<propertyRoot>.n=m
<propertyRoot>.ID.m=<format string>

e.g., for a <propertyRoot> of MessageFormatting.Debug.Event:

MessageFormatting.Debug.Event.0=1004
MessageFormatting.Debug.Event.ID.1004=Link {8}: status is {5} [{4}]

In the above case, '1004' should correspond to a message format or event ID in the client environment. This is the value that will be used to identify the format string later, in AeMessageFormatter.format( int ). 'n' values should be sequential, starting with 0
'm' values should be integers, and must correspond to IDs for which format strings are defined by the subclass.

Overrides:
populateMap in class AeMessageFormatter
Parameters:
aPropRoot - The base key string for the message format group.
See Also:
AeMessageFormatter.populateMap(java.lang.String)

getResourceString

public java.lang.String getResourceString(java.lang.String aKey)
Description copied from class: AeMessageFormatter
Implementors will provide a resource string accessor applicable to their environment. If no resource string is mapped to the specified key, then the key itself is returned (not null, not an empty string).

Specified by:
getResourceString in class AeMessageFormatter
Parameters:
aKey - The key that identifies the desired resource string.
Returns:
String The corresponding resource string, or aKey if not found.
See Also:
AeMessageFormatter.getResourceString(java.lang.String)

getMaxArgs

public int getMaxArgs()
Returns the base set of event arguments. If subclasses add args to the list, they should override this method to return the true # of args.

Specified by:
getMaxArgs in class AeMessageFormatter
Returns:
int
See Also:

setEventArguments

public void setEventArguments(int aEventID,
                              java.lang.String aPath,
                              long aPID,
                              java.lang.String aFault,
                              java.lang.String aInfo)
Set the event-based argument values.

Parameters:
aEventID - The event ID.
aPath - The activity's node path.
aPID - The process engine instance PID.
aFault - The name of the fault involved, if any.
aInfo - Any ancillary info object sent with the event.
